channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: As U.S. rocket launchers help Ukraine strike Russian bases, allies are asking whether it is enough to avert a protracted war https://t.co/pMRzCLscvh
Traders are betting on bigger losses for stocks after a punishing stretch that has pushed the S&P 500 toward its worst start to a year in nearly a century https://t.co/n1VhvR0qOP

Twitter and Elon Musk have each picked lawyers from powerhouse firms for their battle against one another, a fight prompted by Mr. Musk’s attempt to walk away from a $44 billion deal. Here's what we know about each side's representation. https://t.co/ynQ5pJ37MO
Wordle, the viral internet word game, is becoming a board game for sale later this year https://t.co/T97YGRgJIs
Ericsson said the U.S. had authorized its $6.2 billion proposal to buy Vonage, clearing the way for the deal to be completed next week https://t.co/FiO3uGRlAr
Amazon has started slashing the number of its private-label products and has discussed exiting that business to ease regulatory pressure, people familiar say https://t.co/U8Dh2nc8eP

Brittney Griner had a prescription to use marijuana for medical purposes from a doctor in Arizona, leading her to have vape cartridges with hashish oil in her belongings when she flew to Russia in mid-February, her defense lawyers said. https://t.co/D0tUIy3g9f
Shoppers boosted retail spending in June by 1% as inflation reached a new four-decade high https://t.co/m56CGyOoZO

Sri Lanka’s president resigned after days of protest over the country’s economic meltdown, triggered by the pandemic, inflation and growing debts #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/F90VlYzibc https://t.co/POV83lp0Du
Rising Chinese exports to Russia of microchips and other items—some with military applications—are undermining the West's push to stall Moscow's war effort https://t.co/c3GOt9gfiV
BlackRock, the world’s largest asset-management firm, said its quarterly profit fell 22% amid a bruising market downturn https://t.co/vEJ4oeTQXO
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/KkJvEMuq9W

A Florida ice cream company is recalling all of its ice cream after it was linked earlier this month to a listeria outbreak that killed at least one person and sickened 22 others, officials said https://t.co/uNojQe1oor
Second-quarter profit at JPMorgan Chase fell 28% from a year earlier, even as the nation’s largest bank said it's seeing few signs that a recession is imminent https://t.co/30UmgwKXuU
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDOUKJQ https://t.co/KmhFf4KUOn

Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius owes more than $4.7 billion in crypto assets to its customers, and says it plans to make up its deficit partly using newly minted bitcoins from its mining facility https://t.co/mDbTqj2ikC
China’s Xi made a rare visit to Xinjiang, a region where Beijing has been accused of genocide against Uyghur ethnic group https://t.co/QC8wfaiqB1
Disgraced South Carolina lawyer Alex Murdaugh was charged with murder in the deaths of his wife, Maggie, and son Paul https://t.co/3wY4in6oc3
For some, renting, instead of buying, makes financial sense, even when the rent is $10,000 per month. “Not everyone has the American dream of wanting to own something." https://t.co/sMMGomfpXF

Hilcorp Energy, Exxon Mobil, ConocoPhillips and Occidental Petroleum are the U.S. oil-and-gas industry’s top emitters of planet-warming greenhouse gases, according to a new report based on federal data https://t.co/EiXQ0aUaj8

Many Secret Service text messages from the day of the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot and the previous day were erased after a government watchdog office requested them, the Department of Homeland Security’s inspector general told lawmakers https://t.co/iniU3wv6WD
Saudi Arabia will allow commercial flights originating in Israel to fly over the kingdom ahead of President Biden's visit https://t.co/SZpKSQslW1

Emirates, one of the world’s biggest airlines, lashed out at Heathrow Airport’s decision earlier this week to limit the number of passengers departing the hub and said it won’t comply with its request to cut flights to and from the airport https://t.co/ljBKMalBGI
Beijing’s policy of imposing lockdowns in entire cities or regions to squash Covid-19 has depressed spending, investment and manufacturing activity https://t.co/mmRF290lVw
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDOUKJQ https://t.co/yBIM20v1Yu
Amazon has started slashing the number of its private-label products and has discussed exiting that business to ease regulatory pressure, people familiar say https://t.co/XhS8tDv1NW

From @WSJopinion: The rising cost of energy makes winter expensive. Natural-gas prices may more than double heating costs this winter. Nuclear power offers a solution, writes Robert Hargraves https://t.co/0Ri0O2EQ40
In New York's Hudson Valley, a Georgian-style, brick house that dates back to the 18th century is coming on the market for $4.35 million https://t.co/eefBpNdCJ2
Italy’s prime minister said he would resign after his coalition fell apart over disagreements on whether to send arms to Ukraine https://t.co/t37DznQfrO
OpenSea, one of the largest marketplaces for NFTs, said it would be cutting a fifth of its staff, part of a wave of layoffs among crypto firms https://t.co/itTs8tqOHH
Wasps are among the most reviled organisms on the planet, but as their many crucial roles show, even the unloved aspects of nature are valuable https://t.co/AQCcHlAJz9
Ivana Trump, New York socialite and first wife of President Donald Trump, died Thursday at 73 after being found unresponsive at her home in Manhattan, police said https://t.co/lpUnNN1GX0
OpenSea, one of the largest marketplaces for NFTs, says it will be cutting a fifth of its staff, part of a wave of layoffs among crypto firms https://t.co/CLAinRuGBZ
Sen. Joe Manchin has told Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer he won't support an economic package in the coming weeks that raises taxes or includes climate provisions https://t.co/GK6eWfv8vD
Texas sues the Biden administration over guidelines to to perform abortions in emergency situations where a pregnant woman is at imminent risk https://t.co/YFcHKL1ykw

Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius owes more than $4.7 billion in crypto assets to its customers, and says it plans to make up its deficit partly using newly minted bitcoins from its mining facility https://t.co/h5F0yypEev
A former Wall Street bond trader now coaches the dominant team in competitive high school math. “I used to get paid money,” says Will Frazer. “Now we get trophies.” https://t.co/1wzj18CHX2

A Russian missile strike on a city in central Ukraine killed at least 23 people Thursday, as Moscow continued to push a ground invasion that in recent days has appeared to lose momentum https://t.co/ejqqe2MKft

From @WSJopinion: Biden’s pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia this week offers an opportunity to repair a relationship crucial to Mideast security. Whether the two countries can rebuild trust is an open question, writes Karen Elliott House. https://t.co/CvmqFYmicd

Many Secret Service text messages from the day of the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot and the previous day were erased after a government watchdog office requested them, the Department of Homeland Security’s inspector general told lawmakers https://t.co/j1NED84cu0

Alibaba executives have been called in for talks by Shanghai authorities in connection with the theft of a vast police database on an estimated nearly one billion Chinese citizens, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/ekFkBS3lHw
The Kansas City Royals will be without 10 players for their road series against the Toronto Blue Jays because they are unvaccinated and unable to travel to Canada https://t.co/AI2tZvHQmp
Financial and political crises are brewing across parts of the developing world, especially in countries that piled on debt to get through the pandemic and now face inflation https://t.co/UFJm6OCBGM

The House is expected to pass an annual defense-policy bill that would boost America’s total national security budget for fiscal year 2023 to $850.3 billion—tens of billions of dollars more than President Biden requested https://t.co/c8H4aj1WqA
Ivana Trump, who fled Czechoslovakia and found fame in New York as a socialite and an executive in the Trump organization, has died at 73, her family said https://t.co/3p8fnJn5Po
General Motors and Pilot plan to create a network of electric-vehicle charging stations across the U.S., boosting the number of fast chargers available to drivers by about 20% https://t.co/z5WqWWcrLb

As larceny and violent crime rise in New York, bodega owners asked prosecutors to drop murder charges against a worker attacked in a store. The Manhattan district attorney might agree. https://t.co/ASnTLSDmGk

Elon Musk is facing scrutiny from securities regulators over whether he promptly disclosed his intention to terminate his $44 billion deal to buy Twitter, marking the second time the SEC has looked into the billionaire’s required disclosures https://t.co/XYShros5DE
In the market for a new MacBook? Columnist @nicnguyen reviews the redesigned M2 MacBook Air, with a faster processor, bigger screen and better webcam. https://t.co/jXFZjpbwkC
Italy’s prime minister said he would resign after his coalition fell apart over disagreements on whether to send arms to Ukraine https://t.co/cskxRmVdPi
